article.headline: American 72, Colgate 64
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP) -- Andre Ingram scored 19 points and Derrick Mercer added 14 as American defeated visiting Colgate 72-64 on Sunday. Linas Lekavicius tied a career-high seven rebounds and contributed a season-high seven assists for the Eagles (8-15, 4-6 Patriot League), who snapped a two-game losing skid. Kendall Chones and Kyle Roemer each scored 12 points, and Jon Simon added 11 for the Raiders (8-16, 2-8) in their third straight loss and eighth in nine games. The Eagles stretched a 37-32 halftime lead to eight points four times in the second half before Lekavicius sank a pair of free throws to make it 66-56 with 1:34 to play. Including that pair, American scored nine of 10 foul shots to clinch the win. Colgate led only once after responding to an early nine-point deficit with an 8-0 spurt late in the first half to make it 27-26. But Arvydas Eitutavicius answered with a 3-pointer and a pair of foul shots, sparking a 7-2 American run to close the half. The Eagles, who outrebounded the Raiders 38-27, lead the all-time series 9-3. ^

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
